title: Science Simulation Education Design Based on Structuralist Learning Theory (SLT)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific concepts and digital device utilization skills
context.additional_context: Adult learners have experience developing science education content for elementary students. Practicing instructional design applying structuralist learning theory through VR simulations

learning_goals: Learners can apply the core principles of SLT (structural analysis, hierarchical organization, pattern recognition) to explain scientific phenomena.
Learners can visualize structural relationships of scientific concepts and design explanatory models using VR simulation tools.
Learners can analyze learner performance outcomes and suggest improvement strategies using an SLT-based assessment rubric.

resources: VR simulation software for science education
Case materials on structuralist learning theory

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
